p: There are similarities between the neurological complications associated with SARS-CoV-1, MERS-CoV and COVID-19. However, the scope of the pandemics and number of patients involved in each are different. Thus far, SARS-CoV-2 has infected millions of people worldwide. Reports on the neurological complications after and during COVID-19 are growing on a daily basis. Better understanding of the potential associated neurological complications will help health care providers to be more attentive to these complications and a more timely diagnosis and management.
